intro: Willughbeia grandiflora, commonly known as the giant flame tree, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy red flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a dramatic visual impact. The plant has broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, helping to reduce water loss in its humid habitat. Willughbeia grandiflora is typically found in lowland rainforests and can grow up to 20 meters tall. Its rapid growth rate and ornamental value make it a popular choice for ornamental landscaping in warm climates.
